Setting expectations allows preparation of enough resourcesbeforehand, thus preventing problems during implementation.It also helps determine measures early, before a problemarises.
Example of setting expectations:
If the number of under-five clinic consultations
increases by an average of 15 per year and if lastyearâ€™s total number of under-five clinic consultationswas 975, then the expected number of consultationsthis year is 990.
